release.name: v1.0.13 (2025-10-01)
release.body:
## What's Changed
* feat: Otel instrumentation version 3  by @bitnahian in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3021
* Don't send strict to HuggingFace API as it's not supported by their types and at least some models by @DouweM in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3062
* Correctly merge `Model.settings` with `model_settings` in direct mode by @moritzwilksch in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2980
* Expose `server_info` in `MCPServer` by @Whadup in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3055
* Support contextually overriding agent instructions by @mwildehahn in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2926
* Update evals attributes by @dmontagu in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2924

## New Contributors
* @Whadup made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3055

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/compare/v1.0.12...v1.0.13

What's Changed

  • feat: Otel instrumentation version 3 by @bitnahian in #3021
  • Don't send strict to HuggingFace API as it's not supported by their types and at least some models by @DouweM in #3062
  • Coâ€¦

payload.description: GenAI Agent Framework, the Pydantic way

commits.message: Raise error when using image output with Temporal
Include assistant file parts in OTel messages
Use global Vertex region for tests, as it has image-preview model

pull_request.title: Update evals attributes
pull_request.body:
This is meant to add some additional attributes to eval spans for querying/inclusion in tables listing them out.

In particular, adds task_name as a dedicated attribute, and adds a `name` field to `Dataset` which is used to populate a `dataset_name` attribute. The existing `name` attribute is meant to be the "experiment name" and can be set manually, and defaults to the (possibly-overridden) task name if no value is explicitly provided.

pull_request.title: Update evals attributes
pull_request.body:
This is meant to add some additional attributes to eval spans for querying/inclusion in tables listing them out.

In particular, adds task_name as a dedicated attribute, and adds a `name` field to `Dataset` which is used to populate a `dataset_name` attribute. The existing `name` attribute is meant to be the "experiment name" and can be set manually, and defaults to the (possibly-overridden) task name if no value is explicitly provided.

release.name: v1.0.12 (2025-09-30)
release.body:
## What's Changed
* Support Anthropic built-in memory tool by @DouweM in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3042
* Support text, JSON, XML and YAML `DocumentUrl` and `BinaryContent` on OpenAI by @pulphix in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2851
* Prefer `structuredContent` MCP tool result when present by @shaheerzaman in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2854
* Expose `.messages`, `.toolsets` types in top-level `pydantic_ai` to aid IDE auto-import by @moritzwilksch in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2957
* Add cost metric to the pydantic-evals output by @dmontagu in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2984
* Add retry args to `pydantic_evals.Dataset.evaluate_sync` by @m7mdhka in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3022
* Change type of common_tools to work with agent with any deps type by @lukekh in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3037
* Don't error when Gemini returns more than one candidate response by @DouweM in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3043
* Handle Ollama responses without `finish_reason` and document Ollama Cloud by @DouweM in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3045
* Add custom Vertex AI Model Garden example by @stefannae in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2868
* Fix StructuredDict with nested JSON schemas using $ref by @ChiaXinLiang in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2570

## New Contributors
* @m7mdhka made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3022
* @lukekh made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3037
* @pulphix made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2851
* @stefannae made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2868
* @ChiaXinLiang made their first contribution in https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/2570

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/compare/v1.0.11...v1.0.12

What's Changed

  • Support Anthropic built-in memory tool by @DouweM in #3042
  • Support text, JSON, XML and YAML DocumentUrl and BinaryContent on OpenAI by @pulphix in #2851
  • Prefer structuredContent MCPâ€¦

issue.title: Fix Anthropic pause_turn handling to allow agent continuation
issue.body:
## Summary
Map Anthropic's `pause_turn` finish reason to `None` instead of `'stop'` so the agent automatically continues with a new request when this finish reason is encountered.

## Background
When using Anthropic's builtin tools (like `web_search`) with `output_type` set, long-running operations may trigger the `pause_turn` finish reason. Previously, this was mapped to `'stop'`, causing the agent to halt execution and attempt a retry. This led to malformed requests with errors like:

```
ModelHTTPError: status_code: 400, model_name: claude-sonnet-4-20250514, 
body: {'type': 'error', 'error': {'type': 'invalid_request_error', 
'message': "messages.1: 'web_search' tool use with id '<some-id>' was found 
without a corresponding 'web_search_tool_result' block"}}
```

## Changes
- Updated `_FINISH_REASON_MAP` in `pydantic_ai_slim/pydantic_ai/models/anthropic.py` to map `'pause_turn'` to `None`
- Updated the type annotation to `dict[BetaStopReason, FinishReason | None]` to allow `None` values
- Added test `test_pause_turn_finish_reason_mapping` to verify the mapping

## How it works
When `finish_reason` is `None`, the agent treats the response as incomplete and automatically makes another request with the same message history, allowing the conversation to continue seamlessly without manual intervention.

## Testing
- All existing Anthropic model tests pass (51/51)
- New test verifies the `pause_turn` mapping is correct

Fixes #2600

comment.body: @kazmer97 We'd want to automatically do a new request right? I'd expect that to be implemented inside `AnthropicModel.request`/`AnthropicModel.request_stream`. Just having `finish_reason=None` does not cause Pydantic AI to re-issue a request, there's no logic for that currently.

- Updated `_FINISH_REASON_MAP` in `pydantic_ai_slim/pydantic_ai/models/anthropic.py` to map `'pause_turn'` to `None`

comment.body: @kazmer97 Sounds good, ping me once this is ready for review!

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -275,6 +275,36 @@ def tool_for_tool_def(self, tool_def: ToolDefinition) -> ToolsetTool[Any]:
             args_validator=TOOL_SCHEMA_VALIDATOR,
         )
 
+    async def list_resources(self) -> list[mcp_types.Resource]:
+        """Retrieve resources that are currently present on the server.
+
+        Note:
+        - We don't cache resources as they might change.
+        - We also don't subscribe to resource changes to avoid complexity.
+        """
+        async with self:  # Ensure server is running
+            result = await self._client.list_resources()
+        return result.resources
+
+    async def list_resource_templates(self) -> list[mcp_types.ResourceTemplate]:
comment.body: Actually I'm fine with this. @fennb Can you define our own matching types please, as dataclasses with `snake_case` fields rather than `camelCase`?

pull_request.title: Feature: Minimal MCP client Resources support
pull_request.body:
Addresses https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/issues/1783.

Realised that @Kludex started working on this (https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-ai/pull/3020) at pretty much the same time/before I had a chance to push, which probably invalidates this work, but creating a PR anyway in case some part of it is useful!

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -275,6 +275,36 @@ def tool_for_tool_def(self, tool_def: ToolDefinition) -> ToolsetTool[Any]:
             args_validator=TOOL_SCHEMA_VALIDATOR,
         )
 
+    async def list_resources(self) -> list[mcp_types.Resource]:
+        """Retrieve resources that are currently present on the server.
+
+        Note:
+        - We don't cache resources as they might change.
+        - We also don't subscribe to resource changes to avoid complexity.
+        """
+        async with self:  # Ensure server is running
+            result = await self._client.list_resources()
+        return result.resources
+
+    async def list_resource_templates(self) -> list[mcp_types.ResourceTemplate]:
+        """Retrieve resource templates that are currently present on the server."""
+        async with self:  # Ensure server is running
+            result = await self._client.list_resource_templates()
+        return result.resourceTemplates
+
+    async def read_resource(self, uri: str) -> list[mcp_types.TextResourceContents | mcp_types.BlobResourceContents]:
+        """Read the contents of a specific resource by URI.
+
+        Args:
+            uri: The URI of the resource to read.
+
+        Returns:
+            A list of resource contents (either TextResourceContents or BlobResourceContents).
+        """
+        async with self:  # Ensure server is running
+            result = await self._client.read_resource(AnyUrl(uri))
+        return result.contents
comment.body: @fennb Yeah I'm inclined to convert the objects, despite us losing the metadata, and if the user needs it, they can use the client directly.
